info.title: Conversations Custom Channels
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: Allow admins to install an integration with a third-party messaging channel that your team uses to communicate with customers, to allow users in your account to manage their conversations for that channel directly in HubSpot.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the custom channels API to create custom channels to build a bridge between an external message service and HubSpot's inbox or help desk features.

get.description: Retrieve the details about a custom channel. This API allows you to see a custom channel's current capabilties and other configuration metadata

delete.description: Use this API to archive a registered custom channel

patch.description: This endpoint can be used to update a channel's capabilities. You can also use it to update the channel's webhookUri and its channelAccountConnectionRedirectUrl.

get.description: Get the PublicConversationsMessage that represents a message sent over a custom channel

patch.description: Use this API to update a message's status to indicate if it was successfully sent, failed to send, or was read

patch.summary: Update a channel account staging token
patch.description: This API is used for integrators creating public apps. Use this API to update a channel account staging token's account name and delivery identifier. This information will be applied to the channel account created from this staging token.

post.description: This API allows you to create one or more accounts that all talk over a single channel but using different delivery identifiers.

get.summary: Get a channel account by id
get.description: Retrieve a PublicChannelAccount that contains all the metadata about your channel account. This includes information like its channel, associated inbox id, and delivery identifier information.

patch.description: This API is used to update the name of the channel account and it's isAuthorized status. Setting to isAuthorized flag to False disables the channel account.

post.description: Register a new channel along with its capabilities and the webhook url that will be used to receive messages published over the channel
Publish a message over your custom channel

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

statusType.description: Valid status are SENT, FAILED, and READ

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

NextPage.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

scopes.conversations.custom_channels.read: Read messages and manage Channel Accounts for an included Custom Channel.
scopes.conversations.custom_channels.write: Publish messages into HubSpot and manage Channel Accounts for an included Custom Channel.
